text: Tet Layer
Creates layer of tetrahedra adjacent to a polygon mesh.
TetLayer creates a thin layer of tetrahedra adjacent to an oriented polygonal surface. The resulting tet mesh can be used in simulations, for example using the
FEM Solver
or the
Vellum Solver
. Tet Layer turns a polygonal sphere into a hollow ball, whereas
Tet Conform
turns a polygonal sphere into a solid ball.
The tetrahedra share the polygon points. This SOP is not limited to triangular polygons; it may be used with quadrangles as well.

Each polygon has a maximum layer thickness above which tets will start to get inverted. TetLayer automatically limits the thickness such that no inverted tets are produced. This means that the actual thickness produced by TetLayer will be smaller than the user-specified thickness, if the user-specified thickness is too large. For thicknesses much larger than the sizes of the polygons, consider using Solid Conform instead.
For building good quality simulation meshes, we recommend that you apply a
Remesh SOP
to your polygonal geometry before Tet Layer.
Build Controls
Primitive Group
The group of polygons from which a tetrahedral layer is grown. Polygons outside this group are completely ignored.
Build Direction
Interior or Exterior. Interior (Exterior) means that a layer of tets will be built on the interior (exterior) side of the polygons, according to the Houdini winding order.
Thickness
Control the (global) thickness of the entire layer.
Enable Thickness Multiplier Attribute
Enable a multiplier point attribute that allows the thickness to be controlled locally.
Thickness Multiplier Point Attribute
The name of the point attribute that is used to scale the desired thickness.
Output Geometry
Preserve Input Geometry
All input primitives are preserved in the output. New tetrahedra are added and may share points with the input primitives.
